result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcellus L Logan

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 17, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

3:06 PM Defendant Marcellus L Logan in court.  Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Marcellus L Logan.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests plea/sentencing in 60 days. Address verified.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services immediately after court. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward Marci C. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
and returned. Bond form not marked as Amended

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward Marci C. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Trial Judge - Br 12
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

9:03 AM Defendant Marcellus L Logan in court.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. CT has colloquy w/ Defn about right to waive atty for this hearing only. Defn waives right to atty for this hearing ONLY. CT accepts waiver as knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily for this hearing ONLY. CT addresses bail motion. Argument by Defn. Argument by State. Statement by victim. CT amends "Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Marci C." TO "Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward Marci C." CT orders DCPS. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
Bail/bond hearing on August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcellus L Logan in court. Defn qualifies for SPD, notice given to Defn in court.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Letter to Judge regarding victim contact with defn
Pre-trial conference on August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Marci C. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

09:37 AM Defendant appeared.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
